oai_dc:dc.dc:title: SILTATION STUDY IN A LONG APPROACH CHANNEL ON LARGE SCALE MUDDY TIDAL FLAT
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Tsuruya, Hiroichi
Murakami, Kazuo
Irie, Isao
Katoh, Kazumasa
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: tidal flat
approach channel channel
siltation
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Siltation mechanism in a 14km long approach channel on large scale muddy tidal flat is studied based on field investigations and numerical simulation. Natural conditions such as river discharge, waves, tides, tidal currents, and bed materials were measured over one year. The morphological change shows some relations with the grain size distribution of bed materials and current flow patterns. The net movement pattern of bed materials in the muddy tidal flat is given by the analysis of the field data. From the numerical simulation, it is revealed that the resuspended bed materials by waves from the surrounding tidal flat play an important role in the siltation process of the approach channel.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 23 (1992): Proceedings of 23rd Conference on Coastal Engineering, Venice, Italy, 1992.
